trans-unit.source: Custom-provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Custom-provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to custom-provision clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure Classic Portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or a .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to custom-provision clusters for Azure HDInsight by using the Azure Classic Portal, Azure PowerShell, a command line, or a .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to plan for provision HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to plan for provision HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: [Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md)
trans-unit.target: [Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md)

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites:**
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites:**

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Basic configuration options
trans-unit.target: Basic configuration options

trans-unit.source: **Cluster name**
trans-unit.target: **Cluster name**

trans-unit.source: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:
trans-unit.target: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:

trans-unit.source: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters
trans-unit.target: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters

trans-unit.source: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription name**
trans-unit.target: **Subscription name**

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Operating system**
trans-unit.target: **Operating system**

trans-unit.source: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:
trans-unit.target: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.
trans-unit.target: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight version**
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight version**

trans-unit.source: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)

trans-unit.source: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**
trans-unit.target: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.

trans-unit.source: Cluster types offered today are:
trans-unit.target: Cluster types offered today are:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads

trans-unit.source: Spark clusters: for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.
trans-unit.target: Spark clusters: for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight clusters](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight.clusters.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight clusters](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight.clusters.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.

trans-unit.source: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.
trans-unit.target: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes provisioned with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes provisioned with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Data node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Data node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Head servers (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head servers (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Region servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: **Region/virtual network (a.k.a. location)**
trans-unit.target: **Region/virtual network (a.k.a. location)**

trans-unit.source: ![Azure regions](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/Azure.regions.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure regions](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/Azure.regions.png)

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: **Node size**
trans-unit.target: **Node size**

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight vm node sizes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight.node.sizes.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight vm node sizes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight.node.sizes.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the VM size for the nodes.
trans-unit.target: Select the VM size for the nodes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md)

trans-unit.source: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.
trans-unit.target: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see HDInsight Pricing.
trans-unit.target: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see HDInsight Pricing.

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight users**
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight users**

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:

trans-unit.source: HTTP user.
trans-unit.target: HTTP user.

trans-unit.source: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.
trans-unit.target: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.

trans-unit.source: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.
trans-unit.target: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.

trans-unit.source: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.
trans-unit.target: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.

trans-unit.source: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: **Azure storage account**
trans-unit.target: **Azure storage account**

trans-unit.source: **Hive/Oozie metastore**
trans-unit.target: **Hive/Oozie metastore**

trans-unit.source: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.
trans-unit.target: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.

trans-unit.source: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you provision a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you provision a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.

trans-unit.source: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For example, you have a cluster provisioned with a Hive metastore.
trans-unit.target: For example, you have a cluster provisioned with a Hive metastore.

trans-unit.source: You created some Hive tables.
trans-unit.target: You created some Hive tables.

trans-unit.source: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.

trans-unit.source: Advanced configuration options
trans-unit.target: Advanced configuration options

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This section currently only apply to Windows base HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This section currently only apply to Windows base HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files.

trans-unit.source: Here are some of them.
trans-unit.target: Here are some of them.

trans-unit.source: core-site.xml
trans-unit.target: core-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hdfs-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hdfs-site.xml

trans-unit.source: mapred-site.xml
trans-unit.target: mapred-site.xml

trans-unit.source: yarn-site.xml
trans-unit.target: yarn-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hive-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hive-site.xml

trans-unit.source: oozie-site.xml
trans-unit.target: oozie-site.xml

trans-unit.source: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.
trans-unit.target: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the provision process.
trans-unit.target: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the provision process.

trans-unit.source: The following is an Azure PowerShell script example of customizing a Hive configuration:
trans-unit.target: The following is an Azure PowerShell script example of customizing a Hive configuration:

trans-unit.source: Some more samples on customizing other configuration files:
trans-unit.target: Some more samples on customizing other configuration files:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Azim Uddin's blog titled [Customizing HDInsight Cluster provisioning](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/bigdatasupport/archive/2014/04/15/customizing-hdinsight-cluster-provisioning-via-powershell-and-net-sdk.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Azim Uddin's blog titled [Customizing HDInsight Cluster provisioning](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/bigdatasupport/archive/2014/04/15/customizing-hdinsight-cluster-provisioning-via-powershell-and-net-sdk.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using Script action
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using Script action

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Azure Classic Portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Azure Classic Portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Use Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Use Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters-v1/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source: For information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).

trans-unit.source: Provision tools
trans-unit.target: Provision tools

trans-unit.source: The Azure Classic Portal
trans-unit.target: The Azure Classic Portal

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: CLI
trans-unit.target: CLI

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Classic Portal
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Classic Portal

trans-unit.source: You can refer to the [basic configuration options], and the [advanced configuration options] for the explanations of the fields.
trans-unit.target: You can refer to the [basic configuration options], and the [advanced configuration options] for the explanations of the fields.

trans-unit.source: **To create an HDInsight cluster by using the Custom Create option**
trans-unit.target: **To create an HDInsight cluster by using the Custom Create option**

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Classic Portal][azure-management-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Classic Portal][azure-management-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **+ NEW** on the bottom of the page, click **DATA SERVICES**, click **HDINSIGHT**, and then click **CUSTOM CREATE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+ NEW** on the bottom of the page, click **DATA SERVICES**, click **HDINSIGHT**, and then click **CUSTOM CREATE**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Cluster Details** page, type or choose the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Cluster Details** page, type or choose the following values:

trans-unit.source: Cluster Name
trans-unit.target: Cluster Name

trans-unit.source: Subscription Name
trans-unit.target: Subscription Name

trans-unit.source: Cluster Type
trans-unit.target: Cluster Type

trans-unit.source: Operating System
trans-unit.target: Operating System

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Version
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Version

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Cluster** page, enter or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Cluster** page, enter or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Data Nodes
trans-unit.target: Data Nodes

trans-unit.source: Region/Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Region/Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Head Node Size
trans-unit.target: Head Node Size

trans-unit.source: Data Node Size
trans-unit.target: Data Node Size

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Cluster User** page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Cluster User** page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: HTTP User Name
trans-unit.target: HTTP User Name

trans-unit.source: HTTP Password/Confirm Password
trans-unit.target: HTTP Password/Confirm Password

trans-unit.source: Enable remote desktop for cluster
trans-unit.target: Enable remote desktop for cluster

trans-unit.source: Enter the Hive/Oozie Metastore
trans-unit.target: Enter the Hive/Oozie Metastore

trans-unit.source: If you choose to enter the Hive/Oozie metastore in the previous screen, on the **Configure Hive/Oozie Metastore** page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: If you choose to enter the Hive/Oozie metastore in the previous screen, on the **Configure Hive/Oozie Metastore** page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: Hive Metastore Database
trans-unit.target: Hive Metastore Database

trans-unit.source: Database User
trans-unit.target: Database User

trans-unit.source: Database User Password
trans-unit.target: Database User Password

trans-unit.source: Oozie Metastore Database
trans-unit.target: Oozie Metastore Database

trans-unit.source: Database User
trans-unit.target: Database User

trans-unit.source: Database User Password
trans-unit.target: Database User Password

trans-unit.source: On the **Storage Account** page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Storage Account** page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: Account Name
trans-unit.target: Account Name

trans-unit.source: Default Container
trans-unit.target: Default Container

trans-unit.source: Additional Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Additional Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: On the **Script Actions** page, click **add script action** to provide details about the custom script that you want to run to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: On the **Script Actions** page, click **add script action** to provide details about the custom script that you want to run to customize a cluster, as the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Name: Specify a name for the script action
trans-unit.target: Name: Specify a name for the script action

trans-unit.source: Script URI: Specify the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Script URI: Specify the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Node Type: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: Node Type: Specify the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Data nodes only.
trans-unit.target: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Data nodes only.

trans-unit.source: Parameters: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.
trans-unit.target: Parameters: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.

trans-unit.source: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can add more than one script action to install multiple components on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: After you have added the scripts, click the check mark to start provisioning the cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you have added the scripts, click the check mark to start provisioning the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a powerful scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on configuring a workstation to run HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Azure PowerShell with HDInsight, see [Administer HDInsight using PowerShell](hdinsight-administer-use-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [HDInsight cmdlet reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn858087.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the list of the HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, see [HDInsight cmdlet reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn858087.aspx).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While the scripts in this section can be used to configure an HDInsight cluster on an Azure virtual network, they will not create an Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While the scripts in this section can be used to configure an HDInsight cluster on an Azure virtual network, they will not create an Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating an Azure virtual network, see [Virtual Network configuration tasks](../services/virtual-machines/).
trans-unit.target: For information on creating an Azure virtual network, see [Virtual Network configuration tasks](../services/virtual-machines/).

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Blob container
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Blob container

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: You can use either the Windows PowerShell console or the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) to run the scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can use either the Windows PowerShell console or the Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) to run the scripts.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account and storage container are required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account and storage container are required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Storage account must be located in the same data center as the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Storage account must be located in the same data center as the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **To connect to your Azure account**
trans-unit.target: **To connect to your Azure account**

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: **To create an Azure Storage account**
trans-unit.target: **To create an Azure Storage account**

trans-unit.source: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following Windows PowerShell commands to retrieve the information:
trans-unit.target: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following Windows PowerShell commands to retrieve the information:

trans-unit.source: **To create Azure Blob storage container**
trans-unit.target: **To create Azure Blob storage container**

trans-unit.source: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: **To provision an HDInsight cluster**
trans-unit.target: **To provision an HDInsight cluster**

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure PowerShell cmdlets are the only recommended way to change configuration variables in an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure PowerShell cmdlets are the only recommended way to change configuration variables in an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to Hadoop configuration files while connected to the cluster via Remote Desktop may be overwritten in the event of cluster patching.
trans-unit.target: Changes made to Hadoop configuration files while connected to the cluster via Remote Desktop may be overwritten in the event of cluster patching.

trans-unit.source: Configuration values set via Azure PowerShell will be preserved if the cluster is patched.
trans-unit.target: Configuration values set via Azure PowerShell will be preserved if the cluster is patched.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands from an Azure PowerShell console window:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands from an Azure PowerShell console window:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The $hadoopUserName and $hadoopUserPassword commands are used to create the Hadoop user account for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The $hadoopUserName and $hadoopUserPassword commands are used to create the Hadoop user account for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You will use this account to connect to the cluster and run jobs.
trans-unit.target: You will use this account to connect to the cluster and run jobs.

trans-unit.source: If you use the Quick Create option from the Azure Classic Portal to provision a cluster, the default Hadoop user name is "admin".
trans-unit.target: If you use the Quick Create option from the Azure Classic Portal to provision a cluster, the default Hadoop user name is "admin".

trans-unit.source: Don't confuse this account with the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) user account.
trans-unit.target: Don't confuse this account with the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) user account.

trans-unit.source: The RDP user account has to be different from the Hadoop user account.
trans-unit.target: The RDP user account has to be different from the Hadoop user account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Classic Portal][hdinsight-admin-portal].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Classic Portal][hdinsight-admin-portal].

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes before the cluster provisioning finishes.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes before the cluster provisioning finishes.

trans-unit.source: ![HDI.CLI.Provision][image-hdi-ps-provision]
trans-unit.target: ![HDI.CLI.Provision][image-hdi-ps-provision]

trans-unit.source: **To provision an HDInsight cluster by using custom configuration options**
trans-unit.target: **To provision an HDInsight cluster by using custom configuration options**

trans-unit.source: While provisioning a cluster, you can use the other configuration options such as connecting to more than one Azure Blob storage container, using a virtual network, or using an Azure SQL database for Hive and Oozie metastores.
trans-unit.target: While provisioning a cluster, you can use the other configuration options such as connecting to more than one Azure Blob storage container, using a virtual network, or using an Azure SQL database for Hive and Oozie metastores.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to separate the lifetime of your data and metadata from the lifetime of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to separate the lifetime of your data and metadata from the lifetime of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Windows PowerShell cmdlets are the only recommended way to change configuration variables in an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Windows PowerShell cmdlets are the only recommended way to change configuration variables in an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to Hadoop configuration files while connected to the cluster via Remote Desktop may be overwritten in the event of cluster patching.
trans-unit.target: Changes made to Hadoop configuration files while connected to the cluster via Remote Desktop may be overwritten in the event of cluster patching.

trans-unit.source: Configuration values set via Azure PowerShell will be preserved if the cluster is patched.
trans-unit.target: Configuration values set via Azure PowerShell will be preserved if the cluster is patched.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands from a Windows PowerShell window:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands from a Windows PowerShell window:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure SQL database used for the metastore must allow connectivity to other Azure services, including Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure SQL database dashboard, on the right side, click the server name.

trans-unit.source: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.
trans-unit.target: This is the server on which the SQL database instance is running.

trans-unit.source: Once you are on the server view, click **Configure**, and then for **Azure Services**, click **Yes**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Once you are on the server view, click **Configure**, and then for **Azure Services**, click **Yes**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: **To list HDInsight clusters**
trans-unit.target: **To list HDInsight clusters**

trans-unit.source: Run the following command from an Azure PowerShell console window to list the HDInsight cluster and verify that the cluster was successfully provisioned:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command from an Azure PowerShell console window to list the HDInsight cluster and verify that the cluster was successfully provisioned:

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] As of 8/29/2014, Azure CLI cannot be used to associate a cluster with an Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] As of 8/29/2014, Azure CLI cannot be used to associate a cluster with an Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Another option for provisioning an HDInsight cluster is the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Another option for provisioning an HDInsight cluster is the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI is implemented in Node.js.
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI is implemented in Node.js.

trans-unit.source: It can be used on any platform that supports Node.js, including Windows, Mac and Linux.
trans-unit.target: It can be used on any platform that supports Node.js, including Windows, Mac and Linux.

trans-unit.source: You can install the CLI from the following locations:
trans-unit.target: You can install the CLI from the following locations:

trans-unit.source: **Node.js SDK** - https://www.npmjs.com/package/azure-mgmt-hdinsight
trans-unit.target: **Node.js SDK** - https://www.npmjs.com/package/azure-mgmt-hdinsight

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI** - https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli/archive/hdinsight-February-18-2015.tar.gz
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI** - https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli/archive/hdinsight-February-18-2015.tar.gz

trans-unit.source: For a general guide on how to use Azure CLI, see [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md).
trans-unit.target: For a general guide on how to use Azure CLI, see [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md).

trans-unit.source: Instructions below guide you on how to install Azure CLI on Linux and Windows, and then how to use the command line to provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Instructions below guide you on how to install Azure CLI on Linux and Windows, and then how to use the command line to provision a cluster.

trans-unit.target: [Set up the Azure CLI for Windows](#cliwin)

trans-unit.target: [Provision HDInsight clusters by using the Azure CLI](#cliprovision)

trans-unit.target: Set up Azure CLI for Linux

trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedures to set up your Linux computer to use the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI):

trans-unit.target: **To install Azure CLI by using NPM**

trans-unit.target: Open a terminal window on your Linux computer and run the following command:

trans-unit.target: Run the following command to verify the installation:

trans-unit.source: **To connect to your Azure subscription**
trans-unit.target: **To connect to your Azure subscription**

trans-unit.source: Before using Azure CLI, you must configure connectivity between your workstation and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Before using Azure CLI, you must configure connectivity between your workstation and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure subscription information is used by Azure CLI to connect to your account.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure subscription information is used by Azure CLI to connect to your account.

trans-unit.source: This information can be obtained from Azure in a publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: This information can be obtained from Azure in a publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: The publish settings file can then be imported as a persistent local config setting that Azure CLI will use for subsequent operations.
trans-unit.target: The publish settings file can then be imported as a persistent local config setting that Azure CLI will use for subsequent operations.

trans-unit.source: You need to import your publish settings only once.
trans-unit.target: You need to import your publish settings only once.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The publish settings file contains sensitive information.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The publish settings file contains sensitive information.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft recommends that you delete the file or take additional steps to encrypt the user folder that contains the file.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft recommends that you delete the file or take additional steps to encrypt the user folder that contains the file.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, modify the folder properties or use BitLocker Drive Encryption.
trans-unit.target: On Windows, modify the folder properties or use BitLocker Drive Encryption.

trans-unit.source: Open a terminal window.
trans-unit.target: Open a terminal window.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to log in to your Azure subscription:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to log in to your Azure subscription:

trans-unit.target: The command launches the webpage to download the publish settings file from.

trans-unit.source: If the webpage does not open, click the link in the terminal window to open the browser page and log in to the portal.
trans-unit.target: If the webpage does not open, click the link in the terminal window to open the browser page and log in to the portal.

trans-unit.source: Download the publish settings file to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Download the publish settings file to the computer.

trans-unit.target: From the command prompt window, run the following command to import the publish settings file:

trans-unit.source: Set up Azure CLI for Windows
trans-unit.target: Set up Azure CLI for Windows

trans-unit.source: Perform the following procedures to set up your Windows-based computer to use Azure CLI:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedures to set up your Windows-based computer to use Azure CLI:

trans-unit.source: Install Azure CLI (by using NPM or Windows Installer)
trans-unit.target: Install Azure CLI (by using NPM or Windows Installer)

trans-unit.source: Download and import Azure account publish settings
trans-unit.target: Download and import Azure account publish settings

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI can be installed via NPM or Windows Installer.
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI can be installed via NPM or Windows Installer.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft recommends that you install by using only one of the two options.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft recommends that you install by using only one of the two options.

trans-unit.target: **To install Azure CLI by using NPM**

trans-unit.target: Browse to **www.nodejs.org**.

trans-unit.source: Click **INSTALL** and follow the instructions, using the default settings.
trans-unit.target: Click **INSTALL** and follow the instructions, using the default settings.

trans-unit.source: Open **Command Prompt** (or *Azure Command Prompt*, or *Developer Command Prompt for VS2012*) from your workstation.
trans-unit.target: Open **Command Prompt** (or *Azure Command Prompt*, or *Developer Command Prompt for VS2012*) from your workstation.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the command prompt window:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command in the command prompt window:

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you get an error saying the NPM command is not found, verify that the following paths are in the PATH environment variable: C:\Program Files (x86) odejs;C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Roaming pm or C:\Program Files odejs;C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Roaming pm

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to verify the installation:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to verify the installation:

trans-unit.source: You can use the *-h* switch at different levels to display the help information.
trans-unit.target: You can use the *-h* switch at different levels to display the help information.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: **To install Azure CLI by using Windows Installer**
trans-unit.target: **To install Azure CLI by using Windows Installer**

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/**.
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the **Command line tools** section, and then click **Azure Command-Line Interface** and follow the Web Platform Installer wizard.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the **Command line tools** section, and then click **Azure Command-Line Interface** and follow the Web Platform Installer wizard.

trans-unit.source: **To download and import publish settings**
trans-unit.target: **To download and import publish settings**

trans-unit.source: Before using Azure CLI, you must configure connectivity between your workstation and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Before using Azure CLI, you must configure connectivity between your workstation and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure subscription information is used by Azure CLI to connect to your account.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure subscription information is used by Azure CLI to connect to your account.

trans-unit.source: This information can be obtained from Azure in a publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: This information can be obtained from Azure in a publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: The publish settings file can then be imported as a persistent local config setting that Azure CLI will use for subsequent operations.
trans-unit.target: The publish settings file can then be imported as a persistent local config setting that Azure CLI will use for subsequent operations.

trans-unit.source: You need to import your publish settings only once.
trans-unit.target: You need to import your publish settings only once.

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The publish settings file contains sensitive information.

trans-unit.source: Provision HDInsight clusters by using an Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Provision HDInsight clusters by using an Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the Azure CLI:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures are needed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the Azure CLI:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Provision a cluster
trans-unit.target: Provision a cluster

trans-unit.source: **To create an Azure Storage account**
trans-unit.target: **To create an Azure Storage account**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Storage account must be located in the same data center.
trans-unit.target: The Storage account must be located in the same data center.

trans-unit.source: From the command prompt window, run the following command to create an Azure Storage account:
trans-unit.target: From the command prompt window, run the following command to create an Azure Storage account:

trans-unit.source: When prompted for a location, select a location where an HDInsight cluster can be provisioned.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for a location, select a location where an HDInsight cluster can be provisioned.

trans-unit.source: The storage must be in the same location as the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The storage must be in the same location as the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Currently, only the **East Asia**, **Southeast Asia**, **North Europe**, **West Europe**, **East US**, **West US**, **North Central US**, and **South Central US** regions can host HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Currently, only the **East Asia**, **Southeast Asia**, **North Europe**, **West Europe**, **East US**, **West US**, **North Central US**, and **South Central US** regions can host HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure Classic Portal, see [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure Classic Portal, see [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:
trans-unit.target: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:

trans-unit.source: For details on getting the information by using the Azure Classic Portal, see the *How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys* section of [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For details on getting the information by using the Azure Classic Portal, see the *How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys* section of [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster also requires a container within a Storage account.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster also requires a container within a Storage account.

trans-unit.source: If the Storage account you provide does not already have a container, the *azure hdinsight cluster create* command prompts you for a container name and creates it as well.
trans-unit.target: If the Storage account you provide does not already have a container, the *azure hdinsight cluster create* command prompts you for a container name and creates it as well.

trans-unit.source: However, if you want to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:
trans-unit.target: However, if you want to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the Storage account and the Blob container prepared, you are ready to create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: **To provision an HDInsight cluster**
trans-unit.target: **To provision an HDInsight cluster**

trans-unit.source: From the command prompt window, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: From the command prompt window, run the following command:

trans-unit.source: ![HDI.CLIClusterCreation][image-cli-clustercreation]
trans-unit.target: ![HDI.CLIClusterCreation][image-cli-clustercreation]

trans-unit.source: **To provision an HDInsight cluster by using a configuration file**
trans-unit.target: **To provision an HDInsight cluster by using a configuration file**

trans-unit.source: Typically, you provision an HDInsight cluster, run the jobs, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you provision an HDInsight cluster, run the jobs, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you provision a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you provision a cluster.

trans-unit.source: From the command prompt window, run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: From the command prompt window, run the following commands:

trans-unit.target: **To list and show cluster details**

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to list and show cluster details:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to list and show cluster details:

trans-unit.target: ![HDI.CLIListCluster][image-cli-clusterlisting]

trans-unit.source: **To delete a cluster**
trans-unit.target: **To delete a cluster**

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to delete a cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to delete a cluster:

trans-unit.source: Use the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Use the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that make it easier to work with HDInsight from a .NET Framework application.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures must be performed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the SDK:
trans-unit.target: The following procedures must be performed to provision an HDInsight cluster by using the SDK:

trans-unit.source: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Install the HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: Create a console application
trans-unit.target: Create a console application

trans-unit.source: Run the application
trans-unit.target: Run the application

trans-unit.source: **To install the HDInsight .NET SDK**
trans-unit.target: **To install the HDInsight .NET SDK**

trans-unit.source: You can install the latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).
trans-unit.target: You can install the latest published build of the SDK from [NuGet](http://nuget.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Getting%20Started).

trans-unit.source: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: The instructions will be shown in the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: **To create a self-signed certificate**
trans-unit.target: **To create a self-signed certificate**

trans-unit.source: Create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and upload it to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate, install it on your workstation, and upload it to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).

trans-unit.source: **To create a Visual Studio console application**
trans-unit.target: **To create a Visual Studio console application**

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2013 or 2015.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2013 or 2015.

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, click **New**, and then click **Project**.

trans-unit.source: From **New Project**, type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, click **Nuget Package Manager**, and then click **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the console to install the packages:

trans-unit.source: These commands add .NET libraries and references to them to the current Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: These commands add .NET libraries and references to them to the current Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.source: **To run the application**
trans-unit.target: **To run the application**

trans-unit.source: While the application is open in Visual Studio, press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: While the application is open in Visual Studio, press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: A console window should open and display the status of the application.
trans-unit.target: A console window should open and display the status of the application.

trans-unit.source: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: It can take several minutes to create an HDInsight cluster.
